qas.question: How long after Digimon Fusion was a new series announced?
When was the 15th year anniversary held for Digimon?
Rather than a TV series, What kind of series would the Digimon become?
Where are you able to watch the new series when it is released?
When was it announced a tri would be a television series?
Is streaming the television series the same day that premieres
What was announced thirty months after the franchises fifteenth anniversary?

plausible_answers.text: the protagonists from the original Digimon Adventure series

qas.question: Who were now in middle school?

context: <b6_0>A new Digimon series<b6_0/> was announced <a0_0>30 months<a0_0/> after the end of Digimon Fusion at a 15th anniversary concert and theater event for the franchise in <a1_0>August 2014<a1_0/>. The series announced the return of <b7_0>the protagonists from the original Digimon Adventure series<b7_0/>, most of them now as high school students. A countdown clicking game was posted on the show's official website, offering news when specific clicks were met. On December 13, 2014 the series title and a key visual featuring character designs by Atsuya Uki were revealed with Keitaro Motonaga announced as director with a tentative premiere date of Spring, 2015. However, on <b4_0>May 6, 2015<b4_0/>, it was announced that tri. would not be a television series, but rather a <a2_0>6-part theatrical film series<a2_0/>. The films are being streamed in episodic format outside Japan by <a3_0>Crunchyroll and <b5_0>Hulu<b5_0/><a3_0/> from the same day they premiere on Japanese theaters.
